title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MINNEAPOLIS – On a night that belonged to one man, the Minnesota Timberwolves did not merely defeat the Charlotte Hornets; they provided the stage for a historic eruption. Kevin Garnett, with a performance that seared itself into the league’s annals, delivered a career-high and franchise-record 47 points to power the Timberwolves to a decisive 106-90 victory in 1998.

From the opening tip, it was clear this was Garnett’s game. The young superstar was uncontainable, operating with a ruthless efficiency that left the Hornets scrambling. He attacked the rim, hit from mid-range, and dominated the glass, finishing the night an astonishing 20-for-25 from the field. Every possession seemed to run through him, and every defensive scheme Charlotte attempted was rendered futile against his onslaught.

While Glen Rice led the Hornets with a valiant 26 points, his effort was merely a footnote against Garnett’s masterpiece. The Timberwolves’ star didn’t just score; he controlled every facet of the contest, adding a crucial defensive presence that stifled any hope of a Charlotte comeback.

This was more than a win; it was a coronation. Garnett’s 47 points shattered his previous personal best and set a new, towering standard for the Timberwolves franchise. In a game defined by a singular, monumental effort, Kevin Garnett didn't just play basketball—he authored a legacy, carrying his team on his back and announcing his arrival among the league's most unstoppable forces.
